Course Description: This is an introductory course about designing solutions for computation problems using the quantum computing models. It has been shown that these models allow us to solve certain problems more efficiently compared to classical platforms (like Digital circuits or Turing machines). On the other hand, there are certain scenarios where this model is siimlar or even worse than classical platforms. In this course a student will learn about the models and interesting solutions (circuits, algorithms) for some problems from the perspective of computer science.

Course Outcomes.CO1: Students are able to understand the principles of quantum computing
Course Outcomes.CO2: Students are able to understand different quantum computing models used in different applications like search, numerical algorithms, cryptography, etc.
Course Outcomes.CO3: Students are able to Design and/or analyse quantum algorithms and circuits.
Course Outcomes.CO4: Students are able to explain and/or implement simple algorithms and circuits from research papers

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Quantum Cryptography and other topics, paper presentation/report submission
